quote: These ideas can be made more concrete with a parable, which I borrow from John Fowles’s wonderful novel, The Magus.Conchis, the principle character in the novel, ﬁnds himself Mayor of his hometown in Greece when the Nazi occupation begins. One day, three Communistpartisans who recently killed some German soldiers are caught. The Nazi commandant gives Conchis, as Mayor, a choice — either Conchis will execute the three partisans himself to set an example of loyalty to the new regime, or the Nazis will execute every male in the town.Should Conchis act as a collaborator with the Nazis and take on himself thedirect guilt of killing three men? Or should he refuse and, by default, be responsible for the killing of over 300 men?I often use this moral riddle to determine the degree to which people are hypnotized by Ideology. The totally hypnotized, of course, have an answer at once; they know beyond doubt what is correct, because they have memorized the Rule Book. It doesn’t matter whose Rule Book they rely on — Ayn Rand’s or Joan Baez’s or the Pope’s or Lenin’s or Elephant Doody Comix — the hypnosis is indicated by lack of pause for thought, feeling and evaluation. The response is immediate because it is because mechanical. Those who are not totally hypnotized—those who have some awareness of concrete events of sensory space-time, outside their heads— ﬁnd the problem terrible and terrifying and admit they don’t know any 'correct' answer.I don’t know the 'correct' answer either, and I doubt that there is one. Theuniverse may not contain 'right' and 'wrong' answers to everything just because Ideologists want to have 'right' and 'wrong' answers in all cases, anymore than it provides hot and cold running water before humans start tinkering with it. I feel sure that, for those awakened from hypnosis, every hour of every day presents choices that are just as puzzling (although fortunately not as monstrous) as this parable. That is why it appears a terrible burden to be aware of who you are, where you are, and what is going on around you, and why most people would prefer to retreat into Ideology, abstraction, myth and self-hypnosis.To come out of our heads, then, also means to come to our senses, literally—to live with awareness of the bottle of beer on the table and the bleeding body in the street. Without polemic intent, I think this involves waking from hypnosis in a very literal sense. Only one individual can do it at a time, and nobody else can do it for you. You have to do it all alone.
author: Robert Anton Wilson, Natural Law: or Don't Put a Rubber on Your Willy

quote: We tend to be judged because of our actions.
author: Roxy Writer

quote: Lots of men think that women should tell the truth, explain their feelings. These men should use their wishes more wisely. (Prepare To Die!, p.27)
author: Paul Tobin, Prepare to Die!
category: advice, feelings, men, superhero, truth, wishes, women

quote: One way or another, I think we are all destined to learn the same lessons in life. Universal truths are universal truths. They cannot be changed.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: learning, life, life-lessons, richelle, richelle-goodrich, truth

quote: I never talk back. I listen and always remember your every word, so come pen or mouse, never forget that I will treasure your thoughts forever. Yours truly, Paper.
author: L.M. Fields

quote: Since the beginning of the world, a prayer is a prayer and a curse is a curse-- no matter the people-- no matter the language-- Man has given a thousand different namesto his god, but look into the face of each one-- long enough-- hard enough-- You will find one truth.
author: Mike Mignola, B.P.R.D., Vol. 13: 1947

quote: It is our action that determines the viability of our dream.
author: Steve Maraboli, Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
category: action, dream, goals, motivational, success, truth

quote: The true value of a man is not determined by his possession, supposed or real, of Truth, but rather by his sincere exertion to get to the Truth.
author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

quote: Since when does anyone get the option to do the easiest?
author: Jodi Picoult, My Sister's Keeper

quote: We both know that, my friend, but a man's perception soon becomes his reality.
author: Tim LaHaye, Nicolae

quote: You always supposed to have that i'm number 1 mentality,don't let anyone make you feel like you is number 2 when they not even worth being number 1 !!!
author: jojo1980

quote: Imani ni nia ya kujua kisichoweza kujulikana na hupeleka watu kwenye ukweli. Kuamini hupotosha, na ni nia ya kudharau kinachoweza kujulikana.
author: Enock Maregesi

quote: Many Christians are "devoured" by worldly interests that distract them from spiritual service to God.
author: Victor H Ernest, I Talked with Spirits

quote: Is it not by learning to read the book of nature with the eyes of faith that we come to recognize the drop of divinity that resides in our own souls though hidden, master? In the end is this not faith; to seek the light that takes us further, the light of Christ that brings that to which reason and knowledge alone can never raise itself? This is truth!
author: Adriana Koulias, Temple of the Grail
category: christ, faith, grail, knowledge-wisdom, light, love, seek, seeker-of-fate, truth, wisdom

quote: Tonight started innocently enough. Most terrible things do, right?
author: Na, I'll Be Seeing You

quote: I learned a little of beauty-- enough to know that it had nothing to do with truth...
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Beautiful and Damned

quote: WHO KNOWS WHAT EVIL LURKS IN THE HEART OF MEN?The Death of Rats looked up from the feast of the potato. SQUEAK, he said.Death waved a hand dismissively. WELL, YES, OBVIOUSLY ME, he said. I JUST WONDERED IF THERE WAS ANYONE ELSE.
author: Terry Pratchett, The Truth

quote: After so many years even the fire of passion dies, and with it what was believed the light of the truth. Who of us is able to say now whether Hector or Achilles was right, Agamemnon or Priam, when they fought over the beauty of a woman who is now dust and ashes?
author: Umberto Eco, The Name of the Rose
category: beauty, homer, iliad, justification, mythology, passage-of-time, passion, past, right, troy, truth, war

quote: Šausmīgi daudz taisnību. Nojukt var, ja nav savējās.
author: Imants Ziedonis, Epifānijas

quote: The fact that, in the United States, there are people serving ten-year prison terms for growing marijuana plants in their backyards while Wall Street racketeers, who have defrauded millions of people and destroyed the global economy, walk free is a kind of bizarre hypocrisy that boggles my mind.
author: Mark Haskell Smith, Heart of Dankness: Underground Botanists, Outlaw Farmers, and the Race for the Cannabis Cup
category: dank, government, hypocrisy, politics, politics-of-the-united-states, truth, weed

quote: Scarlet watched a leaf fall to the ground, lying dead amoung the other leaves on the forest floor. "A brief life seems pointless."Tristan thought for a moment. "Isn't that what life is, though? A brief opportunity to exist? A short gift?
author: Chelsea Fine, Anew

quote: I point out truths when I see them, Brightlord Sadeas. Each man has his place. Mine is to make insults. Yours is to be in-sluts.
author: Brandon Sanderson, The Way of Kings

quote: Love, he told himself, was open to interpretation like any other abstract indulgence but followed the same principles everywhere, irrespective of everything else. One, either won or lost in love, there was no bridge in between, and he decided he had lost, lost to himself, if not to her.
author: Faraaz Kazi

quote: Certain people will be upset when you speak the truth. They might get mad. They might get really mad. That's because they are still living the lie you've exposed. Stay strong. Speak truth. Do not allow yourself to get pulled back into their lie just to make others happy and yourself miserable. You are free. Stay free.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: There's nothing more aggravating in the world than the midnight sniffling of the person you've decided to hate.
author: Shannon Hale, Book of a Thousand Days

quote: Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing had happened.
author: Winston  Churchill

quote: The worst thing about talk ... is that there's no way to lay it to rest. Every fresh breeze brings a new speculation.
author: Susan Wittig Albert, The Tale of Hill Top Farm

quote: Rhiannon's Law #14: There is a reason the truth hurts. When you cease to feel the sting, it means you've stopped caring. And damn, wouldn't that be a total fucking waste?
author: J.A. Saare, The Renfield Syndrome

quote: There are two kinds of truth
author: The truth that lights the way and the truth that warms the heart. The fist of these is science and the second is art.

quote: Any actor who tells you that they have become the people they play, unless they’re clearly diagnosed as a schizophrenic, is bullshitting you.
author: Gary Oldman

quote: Why does she have to be such a...such a...""Go on," I said. "The truth is never cussing, Son.""Such a bitch!
author: Stephen King, Full Dark, No Stars

quote: The poor themselves can create a poverty-free world. All we have to do is to free them from the chains that we have put around them!
author: Muhammad Yunus

quote: A man without pleasure is a man without any idea what life is about
author: Michael  Grant, BZRK

quote: Truth is always stranger than fiction. We craft fiction to match our sense of how things ought to be, but truth cannot be crafted. Truth is, and truth has a way of astonishing us to our knees. Reminding us, that the universe does not exist to fulfill our expectations. Because we are imperfect beings who are self-blinded to the truth of the world’s stunning complexity, we shave reality to paper thin theories and ideologies that we can easily grasp – and we call them truths. But the truth of a sea in all it’s immensity cannot be embodied in one tidewashed pebble.
author: Dean Koontz, A Big Little Life:  A Memoir of a Joyful Dog

quote: There’s a Chinese proverb that says “Wisdom is avoiding all thoughts that weaken you & embracing those that strengthen you” Your mind is like a Ferrari (Or your favorite car) it is Awesome!...but if you put sand on the gas tank it won’t run. Don’t put sand (negativity) on your mind. Think positive, encouraging, uplifting thoughts, & the negative will soon evaporate.
author: Pablo
category: inspirational, motivational, optimism, postive-thinking, truth, wisdom

quote: And remember that within every lie, there is a truth hidden. Know the truth to defeat the lie.
author: T.A. Miles, Raventide
category: ezelle, knowledge, lie, memory, raventide, truth, wisdom

quote: When boy likes you, you say no thank you. You don't kick him on the ground.
author: Jenny Han, Clara Lee and the Apple Pie Dream

quote: Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own. Imagination is a force that can actually manifest a reality.
author: James Cameron

quote: The truth is not good or bad, it is just the truth.
author: J.B.  Thomas, Little Moments Of Truth

quote: But it is a writer's duty to write and speak and record the truth, always the truth, no matter whom may be offended.
author: Edward Abbey, Postcards from Ed: Dispatches and Salvos from an American Iconoclast

quote: Women were created gullible. It they weren't no babies would be born.
author: Dakota Dawn

quote: Women have no appreciation of good looks-at least, good women have not.
author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray

quote: Ο θάνατος είναι πάντα από μόνος του μια απόδειξη ειλικρίνειας.
author: Graham Greene, The Comedians

quote: If something is wrong, it matters not if a thousand men are for it; you must still oppose it. If something is just, no amount of popular outcry should stay you from your course.
author: Terry Goodkind, Naked Empire

quote: We are always trying to convert people to a belief in our own explanation of the universe. We think that the more people there are who believe as we do, the more certain it will be that what we believe is the truth. But it doesn't work that way at all.
author: Paulo Coelho, The Pilgrimage

quote: Eventually everything connects — people, ideas, objects...the quality of the connections is the key to quality per se...I don't believe in this 'gifted few' concept, just in people doing things they are really interested in doing. They have a way of getting good at whatever it is.
author: Charles Eames

quote: If you're explaining, you're losing.
author: Ronald Reagan, The Reagan Diaries

quote: In God's eyes, a man who teaches one truth and nothing else is more righteous than a man who teaches a million truths and one lie.
author: Criss Jami, Killosophy
category: apologetics, certainty, faith, god, gospel, honesty, intelligence, knowledge, lies, perspective, teaching, truth, uncertainty, wisdom

quote: You have to believe what you're saying if you're going to convince me. I just can't break that rule, even if I want to.
author: Ashly Lorenzana
category: belief, convince, faith, honesty, people, persuading, preaching, religion, sharing, spirituality, thought, truth

quote: When you recognize or experience the truth about yourself you automatically feel love, because love is a quality of your true consciousness and true ideas.
author: Tae Yun Kim, Seven Steps to Inner Power

quote: It's harder to pick and choose when you're dead. It's like a photograph, you know. It doesn't matter as much.
author: Neil Gaiman, American Gods
category: attachment, death, death-and-dying, etiquette, perspective, self-censorship, significance, truth

quote: It is, I suppose, the common grief of children at having to protect their parents from reality. It is bitter for the young to see what awful innocence adults grow into, that terrible vulnerability that must be sheltered from the rodent mire of childhood.
author: Katherine Dunn, Geek Love

quote: ...if desire is predominant it can deform love between man and woman and rob them both of it.
author: John Paul II, Love and Responsibility

quote: The thirst for knowledge is like a piece of ass you know you shouldn't chase; in the end, you chase it just the same.
author: George Pelecanos, Down by the River Where the Dead Men Go

quote: It is much easier to believe lies than the truth." "Why?" asked Janna. "Because lies are manufactured to satisfy the emotions. A mother would rather believe her pretty girl lazy than accept the fact that she's a dumb cluck. Germans would rather believe they were stabbed in the back than that they lost a fair fight. And anyone would rather blame someone else for his misfortunes. The truth is hard. Don't fool with it unless you realize that.
author: Hilda van Stockum, The Borrowed House

quote: I turn sentences around. That’s my life. I write a sentence and then I turn it around. Then I look at it and I turn it around again. Then I have lunch. Then I come back in and write another sentence. Then I have tea and turn the new sentence around. Then I read the two sentences over and turn them both around. Then I lie down on my sofa and think. Then I get up and throw them out and start from the beginning. And if I knock off from this routine for as long as a day, I’m frantic with boredom and a sense of waste.
author: Philip Roth, The Ghost Writer

quote: Clearly I miss Him, having been brought up in religion. But now a man must be responsible to himself.
author: Ernest Hemingway, For Whom the Bell Tolls

quote: No, honestly, my mouth shouldn't be able to function unless my brain's engaged.
author: Jodi Picoult, Handle with Care
category: brain, function, life, mouth, thing-to-ponder, truth

quote: Truth was funny, because it was an insistent thing, maybe as powerful and insistent as some force of nature, the push of water or wind. You could keep it out only so long, but it had its own will and its own needs, and maybe you could keep it at bay with lies, but not for long, not for always.
author: Deb Caletti, The Six Rules of Maybe

quote: Truths are as much a matter of questions as answers.
author: Ozzie Zehner, Green Illusions

quote: My mother was teaching me that the inside of something was not necessarily its outside. Always look carefully, she told me. Look with more than your eyes.
author: Alice Hoffman, Incantation

quote: Shit, money, and the World, the three American truths, powering the American mobility, claimed the Slothrops, clasped them for good to the country's fate. But they did not prosper... about all they did was persist
author: Thomas Pynchon, Gravity's Rainbow

quote: Me truthful... you mendacious.. !!
author: Abhijeet Sawant

quote: Anyway, back to the crush. Sorry to shift gears so fast, but we both know why we're here. I mean, if I wanted to discuss the existential angst of motherhood I'd be writing in a journal. Diaries are for the down and dirty, the stuff you don't want people to ever find out about you. Journals are the things you leave open around the house, hoping a literary agent will wander in, read it and declare you the next genius of your age.
author: Lani Diane Rich

quote: If history is written by the victorious, what if the victors lied?
author: Michael Duncan

quote: Eventually, there's certain limit in telling bare fact through words.It ain't about diction constraints, but common ability to understand.
author: Toba Beta, Master of Stupidity

quote: Telling the truth can be a dirty job.
author: Francesca Marciano, Casa Rossa

quote: Nothing can stop a lie whose fashion has come...
author: Thomas Williams

quote: Confession is always weakness. The grave soul keeps its own secrets, and takes its own punishment in silence.
author: Dorothy Dix

quote: Damn it, how will I ever get out of this labyrinth?
author: Simon Bolivar

quote: Goldstone has done terrible damage to the cause of truth and justice and the rule of law. He has poisoned Jewish-Palestinian relations, undermined the courageous work of Israeli dissenters and—most unforgivably—increased the risk of another merciless IDF assault.
author: Norman G. Finkelstein, Goldstone Recants: Richard Goldstone Renews Israel's License to Kill
category: arab-israeli-conflict, dissent, gaza-war, goldstone-commission, human-rights, israel, israel-defense-forces, israeli-palestinian-conflict, jews, justice, law, palestine, palestinians, richard-goldstone, truth

quote: He that takes truth for his guide, and duty for his end, may safely trust to God's providence to lead him aright
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Art-making is not about telling the truth but making the truth felt
author: Christian Boltanski

quote: Language can't describe reality. Literature has no stable reference, no real meaning. Each reader's interpretation is equally valid, more important than the author's intention. In fact, nothing in life has meaning. Reality is subjective. Values and truths are subjective. Life itself is a kind of illusion. Blah, blah, blah, let's have another scotch.
author: Dean Koontz, False Memory
category: language, literature, reality, scotch, truth, values

quote: Things conceived by minds and made by hands can never be quite the same, even if they try their best to be identical, because they're never the same from day to day or even moment to moment.
author: Stephen King, Bag of Bones

quote: Perception is the lie that we convince ourselves exists
author: Melissa Bradley

quote: Tell all the Truth, but tell it slant/Success in Circuit lies...
author: Emily Dickinson, The Complete Poems of Emily Dickinson

quote: It’s a sort of furtiveness … Like we were a generation of furtive. You know, with an inner knowledge there’s no use flaunting on that level, the level of the ‘public’, a kind of beatness – I mean, being right down to it, to ourselves, because we all really know where we are – and a weariness with all the forms, all the conventions of the world … It’s something like that. So I guess you might say we’re a beat generation.
author: Jack Kerouac
category: beat, beat-generation, jack-kerouac, mind, self, self-awareness, society, truth

quote: What a myth never contains is the critical power to separate its truth from its errors.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: The joke is generally in the oddest way the truth and yet not the fact.
author: G.K. Chesterton, All Things Considered

quote: Davy once asked me if I thought it was better to be a has-been than a never was, but maybe it doesn't make much of a difference. In the end, people are just people, and the only things that matter are whether they are good or bad, loving or unloving, loved or unloved.
author: Todd Strasser, Famous

quote: ..we all do it. We talk about people we don't like until they become famous. Then we love 'em.
author: Daniel Black

quote: No one, from pontiffs to professors, has a monopoly on the truth. In the end, we are all just travelers--not scientists or mystics or any one brand of thinker. By nature, we are scientists and mystics, reductionists and holists, left-brained and right-brained, mixed up creatures trying to catch an occasional glimpse of the truth. The best we can do is to be tolerant of both sides of our nature--knowing that these reflect the twin aspect of the universe--and learn from whatever wisdom is offered.
author: David Darling, Soul Search: A Scientist Explores the Afterlife

quote: There is not a single untruth, no -but after ten lines Truth shrieks, she runs distraught and disheveled through her temple's corridors; she does not know herself. 'I can endure lies,' she cries. 'I cannot survive this stifling verisimilitude
author: Thornton Wilder, The Ides of March

quote: One doesn't intentionally to alter the truth, just enhance it and make it more memorable.
author: John H. Alexander

quote: It's not an easy thing to tell a true story.
author: Allen Morris Jones

quote: There's a weird logic that explains a common truth.
author: Toba Beta, Master of Stupidity

quote: i realize you cant just throw real gems at ppl...because they think cubic zirconia is the real thing lol
author: Fee Scott

quote: Humor is the whole truth.
author: Frigyes Karinthy, Please Sir!

quote: When you love someone, they deserve to know the truth
author: Lorna Seilstad, Making Waves

quote: No one can attain to truth by himself. Only by laying stone on stone with the cooperation of all, by the millions of generations from our forefather Adam to our own times, is that temple reared which is to be a worthy dwelling place of the Great God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The number of those who have nothing to recommend them and of those in whom nothing but good can be found is probably equal
author: Murasaki Shikibu

quote: no matter what you call him...we all pray to the same source
author: Fee Scott

quote: So why did poor artists originally hang around in cafes?""I don't know. Inspiration from the atmosphere.""Ha! No, you've been tricked, too, just like the rest of us. Cafes didn't have inspirational atmosphere at first. That only came later, when you knew artists had been hanging around in them.
author: Arthur Phillips, Prague

quote: It’s a truth I love you,It’s a hope you do,And may I live and die with it,Not knowing that you don’t.
author: Amit Abraham

quote: He didn't want to play football. He wanted to be told the truth.
author: John Boyne

quote: Truth is what your contemporaries let you get away with.
author: Richard M. Rorty

quote: The teachers complain that the students today are all lazy, ignorant, and stupid. But the truth is that you're smarter than they are. You're not even old enough to drive and you already know that none of this matters.
author: Charles Benoit, You

quote: Nothing factual that I write or say will be as truthful as my fiction.
author: Nadine Gordimer

quote: Knowledge is in the end based on acknowledgement.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: It was only vanity and discouragement that sometimes made me feel alone with my endless love, but now that I was taking one of the risks my heart had urged upon me I could also feel I was not alone. If endless love was a dream, then it was a dream we all shared, even more than we all shared the dream of never dying or of traveling through time, and if anything set me apart it was not my impulses but my stubbornness, my willingness to take the dream past what had been agreed upon as the reasonable limits, to declare that this dream was not a feverish trick of the mind but was an actuality at least as real as that other, thinner, more unhappy illusion we call normal life. After all, the intimations of endless love were the same now as they were thousands of years before, while normal life had changed a thousand times and in a thousand different ways. Which then, was more real?
author: Scott Spencer, Endless Love
category: dream, endless-love, insanity, love, reality, truth

quote: Justice based purely on laws is about as accurate as a portrait created out of large low-resolution color pixels.If you stand back far enough it looks good.Come any closer and the glaring approximations overtake all semblance of the original.Justice should be viewable under the microscope, not from a telescope.And for that it needs to be based not on law but on truth.
author: Vera Nazarian, The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration
category: fair, fairness, justice, law, spirit, truth

quote: It would be well to realize that the talk of ‘humane methods of warfare’, of the ‘rules of civilized warfare’, and all such homage to the finer sentiments of the race are hypocritical and unreal, and only intended for the consumption of stay-at-homes. There are no humane methods of warfare, there is no such thing as civilized warfare; all warfare is inhuman, all warfare is barbaric; the first blast of the bugles of war ever sounds for the time being the funeral knell of human progress… What lover of humanity can view with anything but horror the prospect of this ruthless destruction of human life. Yet this is war: war for which all the jingoes are howling, war to which all the hopes of the world are being sacrificed, war to which a mad ruling class would plunge a mad world.
author: James Connolly
category: aggression, civilized, death, destruction, elite, humanity, hypocrisy, james-connolly, jingoism, madness, morality, reality, ruling-class, truth, war, ww1

quote: For outward show is a wonderful perverter of the reason.
author: Marcus Aurelius, Meditations

quote: With the beginning of life, comes the thirst for truth, whereas the ability to lie is gradually acquired in the process of trying to stay alive.
author: Gao Xingjian

quote: Don't forget that we lawyers, we're a higher breed of intellect, and so it's our privilege to lie. It's as clear as day. Animals can't even imagine lying: if you were to find yourself among some wild islanders, they too would only speak the truth until they learned about European culture.
author: Yevgeny Zamyatin, Islanders And, The Fisher Of Men

quote: The media—stenographers to power.
author: Amy Goodman

quote: Neatness, madam, has nothing to do with the truth. The truth is quite messy, like a wind blown room.
author: William J. Harris

quote: We are the decisive factor in the affairs of the universe.
author: Derek Prince

quote: I worship impersonal Nature, which is neither "good" or "bad", and who knows neither love nor hatred. I worship Life; the Sun, Sustainer of life. I believe in the Law of everlasting struggle, which is the law of life, and in the duty of the best specimens of our race — the natural élite of mankind — to rule the earth, and evolve out of themselves a caste of supermen, a people 'like unto the Gods'.
author: Savitri Devi, Pilgrimage

quote: An Idea is nothing but Information, It won't do us any harm until we accept it as perception of truth in our mind, which in time will potentially evolve and construct major events in history.
author: Djayawarman Alamprabu, Feared Intellectualism
category: deception, hoax, intellectualism, lies, subliminal-messages, truism, truth

quote: You will remember that I remarked the other day, just before we went into the very simple problem presented by Miss Mary Sutherland, that for strange effects and extraordinary combinations we must go to life itself, which is always far more daring than any effort of the imagination.”“A proposition which I took the liberty of doubting.”“You did, Doctor, but none the less you must come round to my view, for otherwise I shall keep on piling fact upon fact on you until your reason breaks down under them and acknowledges me to be right.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, The Red Headed League

quote: It is not history. But I am beginning to wonder strongly what is the nature of history. Is it only memory in decent sentences, and if so, how reliable is it? I would suggest, not very. And that therefore most truth and fact offered by these syntactical means is treacherous and unreliable. And yet I recognise that we live our lives, and even keep our sanity, by the lights of this treachery and this unreliability, just as we build our love of country on these paper worlds of misapprehension and untruth. Perhaps this is our nature, and perhaps unaccountably it is part of our glory as a creature, that we can build our best and most permanent buildings on foundations of utter dust.
author: Sebastian Barry, The Secret Scripture

quote: You govern people, you do good and bad things.If you don't have guts to do bad, then step aside.
author: Toba Beta, My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut

quote: Whether Hindus or Greeks, Egyptians or Japanese, Chinese, Sumerians, or ancient Americans -- or even Romans, the most "modern" among people of antiquity -- they all placed the Golden Age, the Age of Truth, the rule of Kronos or of Ra or of any other gods on earth -- the glorious beginning of the slow, downward unfurling of history, whatever name it be given -- far behind them in the past.
author: Savitri Devi, The Lightning And The Sun

quote: The self-congratulatory popular account insists that Dr. King called on the nation to fully accept its own creed, and the walls came a-tumbling down. This conventional narrative is soothing, moving, and politically acceptable, and has only the disadvantage of bearing no resemblance to what actually happened.
author: Timothy B. Tyson, Blood Done Sign My Name: A True Story

quote: The religious definition of truth is not that it is universal but that it is absolute.
author: W.H. Auden, Enchafed Flood

quote: Ellie: "You could lie to me. You could tell me to be encouraged, that good will triumph over evil."Richard: "Good will triumph over evil."Ellie: "Liar.
author: Joan Bauer, Squashed

quote: Belief has nothing to do with facts,especially for the unbelievable facts.
author: Toba Beta, My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut
category: belief, fact, life, people, truth, unbelievable

quote: The truth is not so important as the leaving of it behind.
author: Clare Francis, Keep Me Close/Betrayal Duo

quote: Deriving truth from joy may be far more easier than generating joy from the truth.
author: Toba Beta, My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut

quote: When mortals discuss about the eternity,conclusively it will be a lifetime discussion.
author: Toba Beta, My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut
category: discuss, eternity, life, lifetime, mortal, truth

quote: There was a way in which my grandmother's true self was not these guests' business
author: no one's true self was the business of more than a very small number of family members or close friends.

quote: A person obsessed with ultimate truth is a person asking to be relieved of money.
author: Robert B. Laughlin

quote: Hoax needed to complete the premises of truth.
author: Toba Beta, Master of Stupidity

quote: I never thought of clothes as having a life of their own -but they do. We all wear an outer layer to hide who we really are.
author: Dee White, Letters To Leonardo

quote: Nothing exists without its opposite.
author: Chris Crutcher, Whale Talk

quote: America's intellectual community has never been very bright. Or honest. They're all sheep, following whatever the intellectual fashion of the decade happens to be. Demanding that everyone follow their dicta in lockstep. Everyone has to be open-minded and tolerant of the things they believe, but God forbid they should ever concede, even for a moment, that someone who disagrees with them might have some fingerhold of truth.
author: Orson Scott Card, Shadow of the Hegemon

quote: Jake was close to tears. In that moment he saw the world in its true light, as a place where nothing had ever been any good and nothing of significance done: no art worth a second look, no philosophy of the slightest appositeness, no law but served the state, no history that gave an inkling of how it had been and what had happened. And no love, only egotism, infatuation and lust.
author: Kingsley Amis, Jake's Thing

quote: Even today, I've no idea what the truth is, or what I did with it.
author: Luis Buñuel, My Last Sigh

quote: One special advantage of the skeptical attitude of mind is that a man is never vexed to find that after all he has been in the wrong.
author: William Osler

quote: When you perceive a truth, look for the balancing truth.
author: John Emerich Edward Dalberg-Acton

quote: Pender laughed. "Verify? In this day and age? Who cares about verifying anything? It's all about the speed. Who gets there first defines the truth. You know that as well as any man living.
author: David Baldacci

quote: Sometimes, we feel conscious but unable to move our body. The first thing to do is focus in a prayer, then start to wink frequently.By this way, slowly but sure our body can be moved totally by our persistent willpower.
author: Toba Beta, Betelgeuse Incident: Insiden Bait Al-Jauza
category: body, conscious, control, dream, dreams, focus, life, move, persistent, prayer, secret, trap, truth, willpower

quote: Sometimes I think everyone's an attorney.
author: Michael Crichton, State of Fear

quote: But it was not the boyish grin she had known when he bounded along the low-gravity inner corridors of Battle School. This smile had weariness in it, and old fears long mastered but still present. It was the smile of wisdom.
author: Orson Scott Card, Shadow Puppets

quote: There is no conscience in a real war.
author: Toba Beta, Betelgeuse Incident: Insiden Bait Al-Jauza
category: conscience, life, real, reality, truth, war

quote: Diets are essentially training courses in how to feel fat and feel like a failure.
author: Paul McKenna

quote: He who thinks we are to pitch our tent here, and have attained the utmost prospect of reformation that the mortal glass wherein we contemplate can show us, till we come to beatific vision, that man by this very opinion declares that he is yet far short of truth.
author: John Milton

quote: We are such idiots, We think everyone else has it all figured out. But we're all stumbling around in dark rooms bumping into furniture and stifling our cries so no one will know.
author: Joan Ryan

quote: They will set aside what they have believed about the world, divesting themselves of all preconceptions, all judgments.... They will do it, then they will send their minds out to seek the truth.
author: Sheri S. Tepper, The Revenants

quote: Nature alone can lead to the understanding of art, just as art brings us back to nature with greater awarness. It is the source of all beauty, since it is the source of all life.
author: Eugène Carrière
category: art, beauty, education, inspirational, life, truth

quote: The relationship between truth and reason:"Truth cannot be reached by reason alone!
author: Maurice Blondel

quote: May I have a few friends and many books - both true.
author: Arthur Ernest Cowley

quote: Here was an absolutely compelling road sign. Stay on the road of objective truth - there is objective being and objective value. Stay on the road. There is Truth. There is a Point and Purpose and Essence to it all. Keep searching. You will find it.
author: John Piper

quote: There is nothing to writing, all you have to do is, sit on the computer and bleed your thoughts.
author: Santosh Kalwar

quote: Smartass Disciple: But, you said that it's the truth??Master of Stupidity: O Yes. That is yesterday's truth.
author: Toba Beta, Betelgeuse Incident: Insiden Bait Al-Jauza

quote: Sometimes the truth feels good.
author: Carson Kressley

quote: Fury...sexual, Oedipal, political, magical, brutal....drives us to our finest heights and coarsest depths
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: Smartass Disciple: Master, what are you talking about? None of us understand!Master of Stupidity: Be patient! It is not ended yet. The end justifies the means.
author: Toba Beta, Master of Stupidity

quote: Looking for Truth is not some kind of spazzy free-for-all, not even during this, the great age of the spazzy free-for-all.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert, Eat, Pray, Love

quote: Smartass Disciple: Three years! I've listened you preaching just for this silly truth?Master of Stupidity: Who said I was preaching? Who said anything about the truth?
author: Toba Beta, Master of Stupidity

quote: I was born handsome and I will die handsome.
author: Santosh Kalwar, Happening:Poems

quote: Selflessness. Humility. Truthfulness. These are the three marks of an honorable man.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
category: character, honor, honorability, honorable, horor, humility, leadership, meek, nobility, noble, selfish, selfless, selflessness, truth, truthful, truthfulness

quote: If you don't love yourself, you won't be happy with yourself. If you can't love yourself, you can't love anyone else. You can't give the love you do not have. You can't make anyone love you without loving yourself first.
author: Kemi Sogunle
category: giving-love, inspirational-quotes, love, love-quotes, loving-one-another, loving-others, loving-someone, loving-yourself, loving-yourself-unconditionally, real-talk, reality-of-life, self-love, truth, unconditional-love

quote: Ridicule is the best test of truth.
author: Philip Dormer Stanhope

quote: Truth is immortal
author: error is mortal.

quote: .. the truth is what you can't see but are certain of anyway.
author: Rachel Klein, The Moth Diaries

quote: Mathematics and poetry are the two ways to drink the beauty of truth.
author: Amit Ray

quote: Beware! said the peridxis's voice in her head. Don't let It's shadowy little truth overwhelm the greater one.
author: Diane Duane, Wizards at War

quote: Seit wir den Glauben und damit die Wahrheit verloren haben, liegt zwischen Heuchelei und Ehrlichkeit der letzte Unterschied, der uns bleibt.
author: Juli Zeh, Spieltrieb

quote: Fear nothing but your conscience.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
category: conscience, doubt, fear, fear-nothing, fearless, god, insecurity, integrity, life-quotes, stand-up, suzy-kassem, truth, wrong

quote: Letters couldn't care less whether what is written with them is true or false.
author: Augusto Roa Bastos, I, the Supreme

quote: Stand up for what is right even if you're standing alone.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
category: right, stand-up, stand-up-for-what-is-right, stand-up-quotes, standing-up, suzy-kassem, truth, wrong

quote: Your faith is your conscience, and your conscience is your faith. You cannot have faith without a conscience, but you can have a conscience without faith. Man was designed to be good with or without religion, yet the challenge for many is staying good. Some people claim to be religious but have no conscience, while some people without religion are very much aware of their conscience. Therefore, a religious label does not define your character or validate your worth. In the end, all men will be judged by the amount of truth in them and the weight of their hearts. The heavier the conscience, the heavier the truth. The lighter the heart, the higher it goes. The only spiritual currency one has in the afterlife is amassed in the form of light, in that, the amount you have depends on the weight of your words and deeds in the living. Conscience is everything. Conscience is what connects us to the truth and light of the highest power source of all. God. The cosmic heart of the universe.
author: Suzy Kassem
category: afterlife, awesomeness, bad, character, conscience, cosmic, currency, dead, death, deed, deeds, define, dying, faith, god, good, heart, hearts, heavy, hypocrisy, judgement, karma, label, light, love, power, real-talk, religion, religious, source, spiritual, suzy-kassem, truth, universe, word, words, worth

quote: Truth, like a little dog, will always find its way out into the street.
author: Michael Mejia

quote: If there's one person in the world you should be with, there must be one person in the world you shouldn't be with.
author: Amy Zhang, This Is Where the World Ends

quote: People would rather live in a community with unreasonable claims, than face loneliness with their truth
author: Bangambiki Habyarimana, Pearls Of Eternity
category: alone, alone-but-not-lonely, alone-in-a-cloud, alone-quote, aloneness, herd, herd-behavior, herd-mentality, herd-quotes, loneliness, loneliness-of-life, loneliness-or-solitude, truth, truth-and-lies, truth-quote, truth-quotes, truth-telling, truths, unreasonable

quote: As long as he deceived himself about the truth, he could blame fortune and have confidence in the future. Now the clouds of madness were closing round his mind.
author: Hermann Bahr

quote: The things said most confidently by advanced persons to crowded audiences are generally those opposite to the fact
author: it is actually our truisms that are untrue.

quote: Just like freedom, Truth is not cheap. Yet both are worth more than all the gold in the world. But what is freedom, if there is no truth? And what is truth, if there is no freedom? Both are worth fighting for — because one without the other would be hell.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
category: cause, cheap, corrupt, corruption, cost, cost-of-freedom, death, fight, fighting, freedom, gold, hell, justice, justice-system, liberty, oppressed, oppression, price, regime, slave, truth, world, worth

quote: Nichts Interessantes ist jemals richtig.
author: Oscar Wilde, Lord Arthur Savile's Crime and Other Stories

quote: In God's eyes, we're all the same.
author: Mark Willis

quote: Die Wahrheit wird nicht im Zorn gesprochen. Die Wahrheit, wenn sie denn gesprochen wird, wird im Geist der Liebe gesprochen.
author: J.M. Coetzee

quote: Stop trying to explain yourself. People only understand things from their level of perception
author: within the parameters of their agreement with reality. Save your energy.

quote: If you once tell a lie, the truth is ever after your enemy.
author: Eliezer Yudkowsky, Rationality: From AI to Zombies

quote: The dead never go to their own funeral.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón, The Shadow of the Wind

quote: We all have a voice. Some a whisper, some a roar. If you can roar, roar for others. If you can only whisper, keep trying. Every roar started small.
author: M.L. Shanahan
category: inspirational-quotes, love, motivational-quotes, self-help, selfdevelopment, spiritual-growth, truth, uplifting-quotes, voice

quote: I never feel unsafe except for when the majority is on my side.
author: Criss Jami, Healology
category: beast, beliefs, caution, confidence, cynical, cynical-humor, cynicism, danger, distrust, falsehood, fighting, funny, funny-but-true, humor, insecurity, introvert, loner, majority, minority, opinions, safety, security, solitude, trust, truth, unsafe, vulnerability

quote: I could watch him do this until morning — never asking questions and never interrupting his work. I worship quietly — his intense focus and attention to detail and then, out of no where, I realize the inconvenient, inappropriate truth: ‘I love this man… and it has swallowed me.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, truth, universe, wish

quote: The more attention you give to your loved ones, the less affection you recieve from them.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
category: affection, attention, fanatic, give, less, love, loved-ones, loving-someone, more, much, recieve, them, too-much, truth

quote: I’ll tell you another secret, this one for your own good. You may think the past has something to tell you. You may think that you should listen, should strain to make out its whispers, should bend over backward, stoop down low to hear its voice breathed up from the ground, from the dead places. You may think there’s something in it for you, something to understand or make sense of.But I know the truth: I know from the nights of Coldness. I know the past will drag you backward and down, have you snatching at whispers of wind and the gibberish of trees rubbing together, trying to decipher some code, trying to piece together what was broken. It’s hopeless. The past is nothing but a weight. It will build inside of you like a stone.Take it from me: If you hear the past speaking to you, feel it tugging at your back and running its fingers up your spine, the best thing to do—the only thing— is run.
author: Lauren Oliver, Delirium
category: backward, broken, coldness, dead-places, good, inner-voice, intuition, listen, past, run, secret, stone, truth, voice, whispers

quote: Those who don't value their words, will never value your wishes.
author: Amit Kalantri, Wealth of Words
category: amit-kalantri, amit-kalantri-quotes, amit-kalantri-writer, false-promises, inspiration, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, lie, lies, motivation, motivational, motivational-quotes, people, promise, speak, speaking, truth, value, wish, wishes, words
